faqs.question: What is the property tax situation for non-residents?
faqs.answer: Non-resident property owners pay wealth tax (Impuesto sobre el Patrimonio) on assets exceeding €600,000 threshold, calculated at progressive rates typically 0.2-0.8%. Annual non-resident income tax (Impuesto sobre la Renta de No Residentes) applies to rental income at flat 19% rate. Professional tax advisors specializing in Spanish property can optimize structures and identify available deductions and exemptions.

faqs.question: How are utilities and maintenance costs in Calpe?
faqs.answer: Utilities (electricity, water, gas) average €150-250 monthly depending on usage and season. Community fees (if applicable) typically range €100-200 monthly. Property maintenance costs scale with improvements, generally €1,000-2,000 annually. Insurance costs remain reasonable for Mediterranean coastal properties. Professional property managers typically charge 15-25% of rental income if pursuing short-term vacation rentals.

faqs.question: What is the process for purchasing property as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: Foreign nationals follow standard Spanish property acquisition procedures: property inspection, obtain NIE (tax identification number), hire gestoría (administration firm) and abogado (lawyer), secure financing if applicable, pay deposit (typically 10%), conduct notarial signing (escritura), and pay transfer taxes (6-11%). The complete process typically requires 4-8 weeks. Professional legal representation is essential to ensure compliance and protect interests.
